body_html:
No it is too high. I have recently played with the tutorial code so I am aware what the normal loss range is. The content loss should be in range 1~4. It should be around 4.2 at the first print even.

Loss not decreasing + loss too high can be a result of many things, e.g. wrong lr.

This is not a pytorch bug as you should tune/fix your code.

If the behavior is inconsistent between jupyter and command line, Feel free to reopen.

Loss not decreasing + loss too high can be a result of many things, e.g. wrong lr.
This is not a pytorch bug as you should tune/fix your code.
If the behavior is inconsistent between jupyter and command line, Feel free to reopen.
body:
No it is too high. I have recently played with the tutorial code so I am aware what the normal loss range is. The content loss should be in range 1~4. It should be around 4.2 at the first print even.

Loss not decreasing + loss too high can be a result of many things, e.g. wrong lr.

This is not a pytorch bug as you should tune/fix your code. 

If the behavior is inconsistent between jupyter and command line, Feel free to reopen.
